Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a orange pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse with shelly inclusions, exterior and interior covered with a polished buff-coloured slip, with remains of five lines of Coptic text containing a receipt written in black ink on the exterior and red-painted plant fronds on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.193)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36468) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36468)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 328 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
